example.code: PS C:\> New-EC2Tag -Resource i-12345678 -Tag @{ Key="myTag"; Value="myTagValue" }
example.description: This example adds a single tag to the specified resource. The tag key is 'myTag' and the tag value is 'myTagValue'. The syntax used by this example requires PowerShell version 3 or higher.

example.code: PS C:\> New-EC2Tag -Resource i-12345678 -Tag @( @{ Key="myTag"; Value="newTagValue" }, @{ Key="test"; Value="anotherTagValue" } )
example.description: This example updates or adds the specified tags to the specified resource. The syntax used by this example requires PowerShell version 3 or higher.

example.code:
PS C:\>$tag = New-Object Amazon.EC2.Model.Tag PS C:\>$tag.Key = "myTag" PS C:\>$tag.Value = "myTagValue"
PS C:\>New-EC2Tag -Resource i-12345678 -Tag $tag
example.description: With PowerShell version 2, you must use New-Object to create the tag for the Tag parameter.
